tit.cmt: Japanese Post ではなく、Japan Post の方が正しいと思いますので修正します。

sen.j: 在朝鮮日本郵便局（ざいちょうせんにほにゅうびんきょく）とは、明治時代に日本が朝鮮半島に設置していた郵便局である。
sen.e: Japanese Post Offices in Korea were placed in Korean Peninsula by Japan in Meiji Period.
Japan Post Office was post offices in Korea, which were placed in Korean Peninsula by Japan in Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: Japanese Post ではなく、Japan Post の方が正しいと思いますので修正します。Trans1だと「～とは、～である。」の文が反映されないため、書き換えました。
sen.e: Japan Post Office was post offices in Korea, which were placed in Korean Peninsula by Japan in Meiji Period.

sen.j: 1876年、日本と朝鮮の間に日朝修好条規が締結され、これにより日本は釜山に居留地を獲得した。
sen.e: Japan acquired an enclave in Busan by concluding the Treaty of Ganghwa; Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity in 1876.
Japan concluded Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity with Korea in 1876; as a result, Japan acquired an enclave in Busan.
Japan concluded Japanese-Korea Treaty of Amity with Korea in 1876; as a result, Japan acquired an enclave in Busan.

sen.j: この時設置された政府機関のひとつに郵便局があった。
sen.e: The post office was one of the governmental institutions established at this occasion.
The post office was one of the governmental institutions established at this occasion.
The post office was one of the governmental institutions established at this occasion.

sen.j: 日朝間の郵便物交換の便宜を図る為であった。
sen.e: It was expected to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea and, because modern postal services did not exist in Korea, it marked the start of first modern postal service in Korean Peninsula.
It was originally aimed to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea.
sen.cmt: 書き換えました。「当時の」が訳漏れです。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was originally aimed to facilitate the exchange of posts between Japan and Korea.

sen.j: しかし、これは当時の朝鮮には近代的郵便事業が行われていなかったためであり、朝鮮半島に近代的な郵便事業が実施された最初の事例である。
sen.e: However, this was because a modern postal service was not offered in Korea at the time, and this was the first example of modern postal service practiced in Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, this was because a modern postal service was not practiced in Korea at the time, and this was the first example of modern postal service implemented in Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 1876年11月10日の釜山郵便局を皮切りに、1880年に元山、1883年に仁川、1888年にソウルと朝鮮各地に日本による郵便局が設置された。
sen.e: Japan set up post offices in various places of Korea, starting with the launch of Busan post office on November 10, 1876, followed by Wonsan in 1880, Incheon in 1883, and Seoul in 1888.
Starting with the launch of Busan post office on November 10, 1876, Japan set up post offices in various places of Korea; Wonsan in 1880, Incheon in 1883, and Seoul in 1888.
Starting with the launch of Busan post office on November 10, 1876, Japan set up post offices in various places of Korea; Wonsan in 1880, Incheon in 1883, and Seoul in 1888.

sen.j: これらの郵便局では日本切手がそのまま使用されており、現地通貨で販売されていた。
sen.e: Japanese stamps were used in these post offices and they were sold in the local currency.
Japanese stamps were used in these post offices and they were sold in the local currency.
Japanese stamps were used in these post offices and they were sold in the local currency.

sen.j: なお朝鮮では1884年に洪英植の指導の下で近代的郵便事業が開始されていたが、甲申政変の影響で閉鎖された。
sen.e: Actually, a modern postal service was established in Korea in 1884 under the leadership of Hong Young Shik, which had to be closed due to Gapsin Coup.
A modern postal service was established in Korea in 1884 under the leadership of Hong Young Shik, which had to be closed due to Gapsin Coup.
A modern postal service was established in Korea in 1884 under the leadership of Hong Young Shik, which had to be closed due to Gapsin Coup.

sen.j: しかし、1895年には再開され、1900年には万国郵便連合に加盟した。
sen.e: It was reopened in 1895 and Korea joined the Universal Postal Union in 1900.
However it was reopened in 1895, and Korea joined the Universal Postal Union in 1900.
sen.cmt: 「しかし」が訳漏れです。（前文parとの繋がりがあるのでこの接続詞は必要です。）
sen.e: However it was reopened in 1895, and Korea joined the Universal Postal Union in 1900.

sen.j: 1905年には日韓通信業務合同によって朝鮮半島全土の郵便事業が日本に接収され、在朝鮮日本郵便局に一本化された。
sen.e: In 1905, postal services all over Korean Peninsula were taken over by Japan and unified into Japanese Post Offices in Korea.
In 1905, postal services all over Korean Peninsula were taken over by Japan under Japan-Korea Joint Communication Service and unified into Japan Post Office in Korea.
sen.cmt: 「日韓通信業務合同」が訳漏れです。Japanese Post ではなく、Japan Post の方が正しいと思いますので修正します。
sen.e: In 1905, postal services all over Korean Peninsula were taken over by Japan under Japan-Korea Joint Communication Service and unified into Japan Post Office in Korea.
